item.title: Minikin
item.description: Morphology Minikin, native to The 2nd Realm, have tails, fairly long yet anthropoid digitigrade feet, and small snouts. It is said that the rest of their features were modified by Lwubo, the deity of love and fertility, to be anthropoid in shape.

item.title: Proto-Morellic
item.description: Proto-Morellic1 was spoken in 8,000 YA by the Morellic Minikin2, in the 2nd Realm’s Etavi Peninsula3. Phonology Consonants Consonants Labial Coronal Dorsal Laryngeal Plosive p b bʱ t d dʱ k g gʱ Fricative f v s z x ɣ h Sonorant m mʱ n nʱ l ŋ ŋʱ Vowels Vowels Front Central Back High i u Mid e o Low ä Proto-Morellic: Salanh Dalichu /sä.

item.title: Proto-Snixian
item.description: Proto-Snixian Proto-Snixian: /t͡ʃé:sòn épā:ɫìç/ was spoken in 8,500YA by the Proto-Snixian Minikin. It acted as the progenitor of the Snixian Languages.

item.title: Proto-Tsrawi
item.description: Proto-Tsrawi Proto-Tsrawi: /t͡sʼr̥äʋi pʼinä r̥in͡tä xu/1 was spoken in 10,000YA by a Minikin population in the modern-day Morellic Mountains. They are one of the first known communities to have existed.

item.title: Ram's Head Migration
item.description: Ram’s Head Migration is the name given to the Morellic cultural practice of placing babies in shelters built atop of the antlers of sheep.

item.title: Sarvaran
item.description: Sarvaran Sarvaran: /sɑˈʋɑ́.ɾa/ was spoken in 6,500YA1 in the Sarvaran Civilisation by Minikin. It descended from Proto-Morellic and so is part of the Morellic Language Family.

item.title: Stonechild Imperial
item.description: Stonechild Imperial was spoken in the Empire of the Petrified Child by Minikin. It descended from Sarvaran and so is part of the Morellic Language Family.
